block.p: LEAD: To the Editor: Regarding ''Explorations in a Land of Glaciers'' (Travel, Aug. 21): We returned to Narssarssuag in a small boat (someone laughingly called it the Titanic), sailing for three hours amid icebergs, alone in the visible world. The emergency radio told of a boat accident and subsequent drownings.

LEAD: To the Editor: Regarding ''Explorations in a Land of Glaciers'' (Travel, Aug. 21): We returned to Narssarssuag in a small boat (someone laughingly called it the Titanic), sailing for three hours amid icebergs, alone in the visible world. The emergency radio told of a boat accident and subsequent drownings.

To the Editor: Regarding ''Explorations in a Land of Glaciers'' (Travel, Aug. 21): We returned to Narssarssuag in a small boat (someone laughingly called it the Titanic), sailing for three hours amid icebergs, alone in the visible world. The emergency radio told of a boat accident and subsequent drownings.
Water travel and hiking, particularly by oneself, are still hazardous although there are rescue squads. The Icecap contains crevasses, and warnings are posted not to walk on it.
Greenland is a beautiful and scary place. RUTH A. UNTERBERG New York, N.Y.
